title: Man Utd boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to consider January loan transfers
text:

Manchester United are considering letting several players depart on loan in January.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has been forced to call upon a number of youngsters at the start of the season with Mason Greenwood and Axel Tuanzebe becoming first-team regulars.

Angel Gomes, Tahith Chong, Brandon Williams and James Garner have all featured under Solskjaer in league and cup competitions.

Their progress could stall with the arrival of new recruits and academy player performance manager Les Parry admits more outgoings are likely in January.

"We’ll plan it out and we’ve identified four or five who might be going out in January. Obviously, our first-team manager has a say," he said.

(Image: Sunday Mirror)

“Angel, Tahith, and James could have gone out on loan but he wanted to keep them here and have a look at them on tour. So a decision will be made, no doubt, for January as well. Hopefully, all three will be in the first team and not going anywhere.

“They’ve been presented with an opportunity and they’ve taken the opportunity so now a couple of them are regulars on the team sheet each week. We’ve had opportunities that have cropped up from nowhere. That’s football.

“Hopefully, some of the lads out on loan now will also catch the eye as some have gone out with a perception of their ability and where they’ll end up but hopefully they’ll come back and people will say maybe we’ve got a little diamond.”

(Image: PA)

On the process that United staff members go through before deciding upon a destination, Parry adds: "We draw up a player’s needs before we start the process.

"I’m not kidding that we tick every box, because we can’t, but there have been a few clubs for one or two players, that we didn’t think were suitable.

"On the face of it, it might look a good move, but we didn’t think it was, for one reason or another, so we looked elsewhere.”

United have been tipped to make a move for Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic in January with Solskjaer expected to be given funds to strengthen.
description: Manchester United have been forced to call upon several youngsters this season amid mounting injury problems
